feed.title: SAP Community - SAP ERP
feed.subtitle: SAP ERP Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Anlagenliste zu Lieferplaneinteilungen (PDF) in ME39 fehlt
entry.content:
Hallo Experten,

Die Anlagenliste für Lieferabrufe (Lieferplaneinteilungen), die auch an den Lieferanten als pdf geschickt wird fehlt  in ME39, wird stattdessen aber in ME33L angezeigt.  Dafür fehlt in ME33L wiederum die Anlage zum Lieferplandruck.

Richtig wäre: Anlage zum Druck des Lieferplans in ME33L und Anlagen zum Druck Lieferplaneinteilungen in ME39.

Hinweis 1: Dieses Verhalten ist im S4 HANA Testsystem.  Im aktuellen ERP System funktioniert es richtig.

Hinweis 2: Verwendet wird BUS2013 in Tabelle TOAOM und TOA01, Ist das richtig?

Was könnte noch fehlen? Wer könnte mal bei sich im System nachsehen,  wie die TOAOM und T681Z für MEOSCHEDUL aussehen muss?

entry.title: Multiple entries in VEKP for the same EXIDV in EWM decentralized scenario
entry.content:
We create and manage Handling Units (HUs) in our production plant , which is HU managed. We then transfer these HUs to the distribution center, which is EWM (decentralized) managed, using a Stock Transport Order (STO). Subsequently, we send the HU back to the production plant for any reason.

Upon checking the VEKP, we notice that this process results in three records for the same EXIDV, which  creates issues for us.

Could you please let me know if this is a standard behavior and if someone has experiences the same behavior?

 

Thanks

 

Claudio

entry.title: I am looking for way to run MD51 project planning in the background.
entry.content:
There are no run in background function in this tcode. MDBT only support plant level planning.

There are requirement to run WBS with MRP control parameters different from plant.

SAP ERP #MD51 #Project_planning #background_job #production_lot

entry.title: Change sales order item to individual stock after maintaining delivery priority
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

we want all sales order items with a specific delivery priority to run in the sales order individual stock. Do you know of a way I can implement this? My idea would be to change the item categroy after the delivery priority has been maintained by the employee. But I'm not sure which UserExit is the right one for this. Can you help me?


Thanks and best regards

entry.title: IN SAP SD ,Number of Packages 15 and Line Item Delivery Quantity 16 are not same.
entry.content: User want both number of packages and line item delivery quantity are same.

entry.title: FINT and value date for outstanding receivables
entry.content:
Hello SAP-Friends,

is there any way that FINT is able to take the value date of the EBST-posting into account during calculation of the outstanding days of receivables. I know we can set up tolerance-days and transfer-days and calendars in the FINT-customizing, but it is not really the same thing. My business desires to have the calucation of interest days not between due date and clearing date, but between the due date and the value date (VALUT) of the posting of the EBST (electronic bank statement). 

Did you hear a requirement like this before?
Thanks for your suggestions, thoughts, opinions.

KR
Christina

ps: My business sees that the SEPA-realtimetransfers as a risk, that we get more differences between value date and clearing date.

entry.title: URL-iView shrinked in MS EDGE
entry.content: in case there are two URL-iviews with automatic height defined in one page and accessing WD ABAP applications, the page opens with shrinked height but only in MS EDGE and not in in Mozilla Firefox and not for all users but some. Closing and reopening the MS EDGE solves the problem but next day it reoccurs.

entry.title: To close old STOs with open archived OBDs that have been Archived
entry.content: Can someone tell a standard way to close old STOs with open archived OBDs without unarchiving OBDs.

entry.title: Before / After – SAP UI Redesign
entry.content:
When I looked at the old screen, the main issues I noticed were not only visual but structural:
•Poor hierarchy → information was presented at the same level, which made it harder for the user to know where to focus first.
•User distraction → too many elements with equal weight distracted the employee from the main task.
•Navigation challenges → actions were not clearly grouped, so the workflow felt fragmented.
•Overloaded tables → data was shown without enough spacing or prioritization, creating cognitive load.

For ERP systems like SAP, the priority is not just to make the interface “look good.” The real challenge is User Experience (UX):
•Helping users perform complex tasks efficiently.
•Reducing errors and time spent on repetitive actions.
•Making the workflow intuitive even with heavy data and multiple modules.

That’s why in this redesign, my focus was on clarity, task hierarchy, and reducing friction. The UI itself is simple, but the main value comes from a UX approach that improves how people interact with the system daily.

The next iterations will be aligned with the SAP Fiori guidelines, combining both usability and a consistent visual design.

entry.title: Creation of PO in a storage location not available for the material
entry.content:
Hello,

 

At the PO creation level, why does the system let you create a PO in a storage location not available for the material?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Vendor Down-Payment with F110
entry.content:
Dear Sap-ers,

I have a request for a Customer of mine, to make a change in the Down-payment request payment - F110.

Currently SAP F110 makes a clearing of a DP request with Sp. G/L Indicator F and post on Vendor Account item with Sp. G/L Indicator A - as best Practice. The entry is posted with Document Type KZ (default figure in FBZP Customizing) - the setting is similar for normal Payments and Paid Downpayments to Vendors.

The clue is that the Customer uses SAP Analitic Cloud and due to data structure the Sp. G/L Indicator is not replicated for reporting  - and only Value to check different types of Transactions in AP for the SAC Report "Vendor Open Item" is the Document Type.

Do you know a way to make F110 clearing process to use a different Document Type for nomal items and different for Down-payments ??

I tried a Substitution - but it's not used during F110.

 

Any idea ??

 

Thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Preq created with PDT & GR Proc. time from material master during MRP run
entry.content:
During the MRP run, the system considered the Planned Delivery Time and GR Processing Time from the contract and created planned orders, as the dates were not within the opening period. However, the PDT and GR Processing Time fields displayed are from the material master (which is expected). When we run the program RMCVPLRQ to convert planned orders to purchase requisitions, it uses the values from the planned order, which were originally taken from the material master. As a result, the purchase requisitions are created using the values from the material master, not from the contract.

Parameters used:

  • Processing Key: NETCH
  • Create Purchase Requisition: 2
  • SA Delivery Schedule Lines: 1
  • Create MRP List: 2
  • Planning Mode: 1
  • Scheduling: 1

If PDT & GR Proc. time are different for material master and agreement/info record, how to tackle this issue?

entry.title: Health checks on new ECC 6.0 EHP8 system
entry.content:
I'm busy with an up-to-date installation of ECC 6.0 EHP8 on Windows Server 2019 with SQL server 2014. For the stack I chose just SAP ECC and no addons. Right after SWPM finishes I pause SUM to do health checks on the SPS 1 system before proceeding with the updates.

When I run RSNTABCONSISTENCY/RSDDCHECK on all objects (both checks enabled), it finds hundreds of inconsistent objects. Is this normal and expected, or is there a problem with the installation?

I also noticed error LOAD_PROGRAM_TABLE_MISMATCH in each case in the Syslog right after SWPM completes.

I've tried kernels 7.53 and 7.54 on SQL 2014, and I've tried kernel 7.54 with SQL 2017. All these scenarios seem to find the same inconsistent objects, so the problem doesn't seem to be with kernel or DB compatibility. SQL 2014 is the highest version that is fully compatible with the SPS1 stack that SWPM deploys at first.

Do these errors indicate a failed installation? SWPM never shows any errors and reports a successful installation. Are there any other health checks I can run other than SICK and missing objects in DB02?

entry.title: SQ01 query with two info structures tables
entry.content:
Hello All,

Can we create SQ01 Query by joining with two info structures S961 and S911? Please confirm.

Also, Please confirm the purpose of S911 and S961 infostructures?

when we try to execute both S911 and S961 infostructures in MCSI with same sales org, plant and material and date -  both reports showing different results. what would be the reason for this? Please confirm.

Thanks in Advance.

Regards, Venkat.

entry.title: IC Returns SNOTE 3317277 - impact for additional SalesOrg/Plant assignement
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

project of  ECC into S4/HANA transformation is ongoing in my company.

Issue has been noticed in S4 DEV, in which SNote 3317277 is implemented by Support Package 02 component S4CORE 108  and does change the IC Return Process: 

For Delivery of the STO Return item, SalesOrg of the returning Organization is determined for Shipping to be received at the original plant. This is a kind of cross-company reverse delivery which activate, as a side-effect, unwanted cross-company sales, due to the fact that is not possible to create Outbound delivery for STO Return unless needed other company"s plant assignment to respective Sales org./Distr. Channel is done.

Therefore, could you please advise how to continue IC Returns without adding new settings for cross-company sales (in table TVKWZ)?

Thank you.

 

Best regards,

Snezana

entry.title: Multiple asset transfer between company's branches/divisions
entry.content: Hi. Our team is implementing SAP ERP for a bank. The system is SAP S/4HANA 2023 om-premise. There are several branches and other divisions within the bank. When we want to do an asset transfer from one branch/division to another one (from one cost center to another one), we need a financial posting to be able to calculate spendings and to make a balance for each branch. Each branch is a separate profit center and a separate cost center, while divisions in Head Office have one profit center but separate cost centers. We found <Intracompany asset transfer> application to proceed with the transfer. Do I understand right, that in this case this is the best suitable application for registering asset movement? When we make a single asset transfer the sending asset is credited and the receiving asset is debited, but I can't find the underlying transactions: I understood that the sending asset should be credited, a clearing account of the appropriate cost center/profit center should be debited, then the clearing account should be credited and then the receiving asset should be debited. Am I wrong? Besides, could you please suggest if there is an opportunity to transfer asset to a new one in case of multiple asset transfer? Thank you in advance for your experienced answers and time spent.

entry.title: WCM - Can't find "Released for Execution" button on my Order
entry.content:
I have activated WCM. When I assign the WCM control key, I see the WC Approval button on top.

 

The order remains in CRTD state, I don't see the Released for Execution button on SAP PM Order. 

 

Due to that I have to manually relase the work order so that I can do work in WCM Applications. 

 

Please help.

entry.content:

How can I do that to the PM work order?

entry.title: Dedicated SAP Aspirant Seeking Mentorship – Offering Unique Value in Return
entry.content:
Dear Mentor,

I’m currently based near Tokyo, having moved to Japan with a singular focus: to build a career in SAP. I hold near-native Japanese fluency (JLPT N1 level), and my previous experience using SAP has shown me firsthand the challenges users face. I’m determined to transition into the integrator or solutions architect side of SAP, with the long-term goal of working across global markets.

I understand that mentorship is a two-way relationship. To bring immediate value, I can leverage my local knowledge and language skills to craft a personalized trip through Japan for you—serving as both interpreter and guide to provide an authentic, insider experience.

This offer isn’t just about a trade; it’s proof of my dedication and resourcefulness in pursuing this path. I would be honored to learn under your guidance and assure you that your investment of time will be well-placed.

Sincerely,
Rye
